Description: Rim and body sherd from Attic pottery lip-cup; outside, lip reserved, body black; inside black glazed apart from narrow reserved line at rim; sharp carination outside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 60, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1345)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2946 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
Miscellaneous number: VII.14 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
